com.chap.links.client

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
      • com.chap.links.client.Graph

  • public class Graph
extends
    The Graph is a visualization chart to display one ore multiple data sets on a timeline The Graph is developed in javascript as a Google Visualization Chart. This Graph class is a GWT wrapper for the javascript code.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Graph.DateRange
      DateRange contains a start date and an end date
      static class  Graph.Options
      Options for drawing the Graph.
      class  Graph.ValueRange
      ValueRange contains a start and end number

      • Graph

        public Graph(DataTable data,
     Graph.Options options)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        data - A google visualisation datatable containing the data. The table has two or more columns: date (type DATETIME), value (type NUMBER), ...
        options - A name/value map containing settings for the graph. See the class Network.Options for all available options

    • Method Detail

      • redraw

        public void redraw()
        Redraw the Graph

      • addRangeChangeHandler

        public final void addRangeChangeHandler(com.google.gwt.visualization.client.events.RangeChangeHandler handler)
        Add a changerange handler. The changerange event is fired repeatedly while the visible range is being changed by user interaction (moving or zooming), but not after a call to the setVisibleChartRange method. The new range can be retrieved by calling getVisibleChartRange method.
        Parameters:
        handler - A select handler

      • addRangeChangedHandler

        public final void addRangeChangedHandler(RangeChangedHandler handler)
        Add a changeranged handler. The changeranged event is fired once after the visible range has been changed by user interaction (moving or zooming), but not after a call to the setVisibleChartRange method. The new range can be retrieved by calling getVisibleChartRange method.
        Parameters:
        handler - A select handler

      • addReadyHandler

        public final void addReadyHandler(com.google.gwt.visualization.client.events.ReadyHandler handler)
        Add a ready handler. The ready event is fired when the Graph is ready for external method calls.
        Parameters:
        handler - A ready handler

      • getValueRange

        public Graph.ValueRange getValueRange()
        Retrieve the (vertical) value range.

      • setValueRange

        public void setValueRange(double start,
                 double end)
        Adjust the (vertical) value range to fit all data.
        Parameters:
        start - the start value
        end - the end value

      • setValueRangeAuto

        public void setValueRangeAuto()
        Adjust the (vertical) value range to fit all data.

      • setVisibleChartRange

        public void setVisibleChartRange(java.util.Date start,
                        java.util.Date end)
        Set a new start and end date Use the function redraw() to redraw after changing the time
        Parameters:
        start - A Date object containing the start date.
        end - A Date object containing the end date.

      • setVisibleChartRangeAuto

        public void setVisibleChartRangeAuto()
        Move the visible range such that all loaded events are within the visible range. This method does not trigger a rangechange event.
        Parameters:
        start - A Date object containing the start date.
        end - A Date object containing the end date.

      • setVisibleChartRangeNow

        public void setVisibleChartRangeNow()
        Move the visible range such that the current time is located in the center of the timeline. This method does not trigger a rangechange event.
        Parameters:
        start - A Date object containing the start date.
        end - A Date object containing the end date.

      • getVisibleChartRange

        public Graph.DateRange getVisibleChartRange()
        returns the current value of the start Date
        Returns:
        {Date} start A Date object

      • setAutoScale

        public void setAutoScale(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable autoscaling. If enable true or not defined, autoscaling is enabled. If false, autoscaling is disabled.
        Parameters:
        enable -

      • setScale

        public void setScale(Graph.Options.SCALE scale,
            double step)
        Set a custom scale. Automatic scaling will be disabled. For example scale=SCALE.MINUTES and step=5 will result in minor steps of 5 minutes, and major steps of an hour. Available scales: MILLISECOND, SECOND, MINUTE, HOUR, DAY, MONTH, YEAR. As step size, choose for example 1, 2, 5, or 10.
        Parameters:
        scale -
        step -

      • draw

        public void draw(JavaScriptObject data,
        Graph.Options options)
        Draws the visualization providing a Javascript array with data example data: String json =
        "[{ " +
        " \"label\" : \"Dataset A\", " +
        " \"data\" : [" +
        " {\"date\": 1281823200000, \"value\" : 12.5}," +
        " {\"date\": 1281909600000, \"value\" : 3.5}" +
        " ]" +
        " }," +
        " {" +
        " \"label\" : \"Dataset B\"," +
        " \"data\" : [" +
        " {\"date\": 1281823200000, \"value\" : 3.2}," +
        " {\"date\": 1281996000000, \"value\" : 6.1}" +
        " ]" +
        " }]";
        JavaScriptObject data = JsonUtils.safeEval(json);
        Parameters:
        data - The data, as a Javascript Array
        options - The options for drawing this visualization.
